onboardingWebsiteUrl.description: Website on which user has to on-board

status.description: Whether the market is ACTIVE or INACTIVE

baseAssetName.description: Name of the asset being traded

quoteAssetSymbol.description: The quote asset symbol,  USDT or USDC

quoteAssetName.description: Name of quote asset symbol, USD tether, or USD coin

maintenanceMarginReq.description: Minimum maintenance margin required by the market (max leverage)

initialMarginReq.description: Limit for a position's margin ratio

stepSize.description: Number of digits allowed after decimal in the base asset

tickSize.description: Number of digits allowed after decimal in quote asset

minOrderSize.description: Minimum size of order allowed in the concerned market

maxLimitOrderSize.description: Maximum size of limit order allowed in the concerned market

maxMarketOrderSize.description: Maximum size of market order allowed in the concerned market

insurancePoolRatio.description: Ratio of insurance pool from liquidation

mtbLong.description: Market take bound applied to each LONG trade/order placement

mtbShort.description: Market take bound applied to each SHORT trade/order placement

maxAllowedOIOpen.description: Maximum order value allowed at leverage

_24hrVolume.description: Total market volume in last 24hrs of asset

_24hrQuoteVolume.description: Total market volume in last 24hrs in USDC

nextFundingTime.description: Time of next funding rate update

marketPrice.description: Its a last trade price if both bestBid and bestAsk are zero, otherwise it's the non-zero value, or the median of both if both are present.

midMarketPrice.description: The mid-market price is the simple average of the best bid and the best ask price

Record_string.any_.description: Construct a type with a set of properties K of type T

canTrade.description: Indicates whether the user can trade

totalPositionQtyReduced.description: Total quantity reduced across all positions

totalPositionQtyReducible.description: Total quantity reducible across all positions

totalUnrealizedProfit.description: Total unrealized PNL across all open positions

totalExpectedPnl.description: Total expected PNL across all open positions

walletBalance.description: Total on-chain wallet balance (only accounts for margin deposited into exchange and margin locked in positions)

freeCollateral.description: Total free collateral (accounts for wallet balance and margin locked in off-chain open orders)

accountValue.description: Total of value locked in the exchange accounting for available balance, margin in positions, and PNL

Partial_AuxiliaryContractAddresses_.description: Make all properties in T optional

Partial_AuxiliaryPackageDetails_.description: Make all properties in T optional

limit.description: Maximum number of bids and asks to return

asks.description: Index 0 is price, index 1 is quantity at price bin

bids.description: Index 0 is price, index 1 is quantity at price bin

bestBidPrice.description: The best bid price on orderbook at the moment

bestBidQty.description: The best bid quantity on orderbook at the moment

bestAskPrice.description: The best ask price on orderbook at the moment

bestAskQty.description: The best ask quantity on orderbook at the moment

midPrice.description: The mid-market price is the simple average of the best bid and the best ask price

lastUpdatedAt.description: Timestamp at which last change in orderbook state took place

orderbookUpdateId.description: Count indicating the number of changes in orderbok state

responseSentAt.description: The time at which orderbook server sent the response

oraclePriceLastUpdateAt.description: Timestamp of the last time the oracle price was updated

id.description: A unique incremental id assigned by DB to each order when it is created

requestTime.description: Timestamp at which order request was made

cancelReason.description: Provides cancellation reason; if the order was cancelled

cancelReasonMessage.description: Provides cancellation message If the order was cancelled

symbol.description: Market symbol on which order is placed

timeInForce.description: Specify the type of how order is executed, and by default, all orders are GTC

userAddress.description: Address of the account placing order

reduceOnly.description: Order should only reduce a position, default False

expiration.description: Timestamp at which order will expire

salt.description: A random number for uniqueness of order

filledQty.description: If the order was partially or fully filled, its filled quantity

avgFillPrice.description: Average price at which order was filled

makerFee.description: Amount of fee paid by the user as a maker on this order

takerFee.description: Amount of fee paid by the user as taker on this order

createdAt.description: Timestamp at which order was created in the database

updatedAt.description: Timestamp at which order was last updated in the database

postOnly.description: If set to TRUE, the order can only be a maker order

cancelOnRevert.description: If set to TRUE, the order will never be re-queued

symbol.description: Market for which to create order

userAddress.description:
Defaults to address of the account placing order,
optionally specify parent account if trading as a subaccount

price.description: Price at which to place an order. Will be zero for a market order

reduceOnly.description: Order should only reduce a position, default False

leverage.description: Leverage must be an integer value and match the user-set market leverage

salt.description: A random number for uniqueness of order. Generated randomly if not provided

expiration.description: Time at which order will expire. Will be set to 1 month for LIMIT orders if not provided

timeInForce.description: Specify order execution, and by default, all orders are GTC

postOnly.description: If set to TRUE, the order can only be a maker order

cancelOnRevert.description: Pass true if you wish for your order never to be re-queued

signerAddress.description: Address of the user that created the order signature (maybe a whitelisted subaccount)

groupId.description: If specified, this indicates the maker's institution

orderbookOnly.description: Orders propagated through our exchange must have this value set to true

hash.description: Hash of the order to be cancelled.

symbol.description: Market symbol to which order belongs to

orderHashes.description: Hash(es) of the orders to be cancelled

time.description: Time at which trade took place

side.description: Either the trade is a BUY or a SELL

isPaymentPositive.description: Whether payment was deducted or added

side.description: Side of position, is LONG or SHORT

referralAddress.description: The referral address associated with the generated code

message.description: An optional message providing additional information

referralCode.description:
The referral code to be generated for the campaign. It should be a string
composed of letters and numbers, not more than 15 characters.

campaignId.description: The identifier of the campaign for which the referral code is generated.

referralCode.description: The referral code used for linking the referred user

refereeAddress.description: The address of the referred user

campaignId.description: The identifier of the campaign to which the user is linked

message.description: An optional message providing additional information

referralCode.description: The referral code used to link the referred user.

campaignId.description: The identifier of the campaign to which the user is being linked.

isReferee.description: Indicating if the user is a referee in a given campaign

id.description: The unique identifier for the campaign

parentCampaignName.description: The name of the parent campaign if applicable

startDate.description: The start date of the campaign in string format

endDate.description: The end date of the campaign in string format

isActive.description: Indicates whether the campaign is currently active

epochDurationSeconds.description: The duration of each epoch in seconds

refereeDiscount.description: The discount on trading fees applicable for referred users

shareOfFees.description: The proportion of the referred users' fees paid to be disbursed as rewards to the referring user

tokenShare.description: The proportion of campaign rewards distributed as BLUE points

cashShare.description: The proportion of campaign rewards distributed as cash (USD)

endDate.description: The end date of the reward calculation period

cursor.description: A cursor for navigating the pagination of results

liquidityScore.description: Will be available if the symbol provided in the request

uptimePercentage.description: Will be available if the symbol provided in the request

isWhitelist.description: Indicates whether the user is on the whitelist for market maker activities

avgEntryPrice.description: The average entry price of position opening

margin.description: Amount of margin/USDC user has locked into position. It will be in base x 10^18 format

liquidationPrice.description: The price at which the position will get liquidated

midMarketPrice.description: The mid-market price is the simple average of the best bid and the best ask price

leverage.description: The leverage at which the order is placed

unrealizedProfit.description: The PNL has not been realized yet

positionSelectedLeverage.description: The rounded-off leverage value to be displayed on the UI

indexPrice.description: Most fair index price in all markets

fundingDue.description: The margin required for pending funding on your position to pay to perpetual

commission.description: Commission/fee charged by the protocol on trade

commissionAsset.description: Asset class in which fee is charged; for now, it's only USDC

side.description: If the order was BUY or SELL

price.description: Price at which order was executed in base x 10^18 format

quantity.description: Quantity of the order in base x 10^18 format

get.description: Retrieves combined exchange info, market, and metadata.

parameters.description: Market symbol
parameters.name: symbol

get.description:
Retrieves user on-chain account information.
Specify the parent address if trading as a sub-account.

parameters.description: Used to fetch parent account details
parameters.name: parentAddress

post.description:
This method allows users to update the market leverage.
All orders for a given market must be placed at the same leverage as the user-set market leverage.
This method will force the cancellation of any remaining open orders at the previous market leverage.

200.description: Tuple upload [openTime: number, openPrice: string, highPrice: string, lowPrice: string, closePrice: string, volume: string, closeTime: number, quoteAssetVolume: string, noOfTrades: number, takerBuyAssetVolume: string, takerBuyQuoteVolume: string,  symbol: string]

get.description: Retrieves candle stick data for a market.

parameters.description: The market symbol for which the user wishes to get candle stick data.
parameters.name: symbol

parameters.description: The time of writing the docs exchange supports the following intervals: "1m", "3m", "5m", "15m", "30m", "1h", "2h", "4h", "6h", "8h", "12h", "1d", "1w", "1M"
parameters.name: interval

parameters.description: Starting time for the first candle stick
parameters.name: startTime

parameters.description: Ending time for last candle stick
parameters.name: endTime

parameters.description: Number of candles to fetch, the maximum allowed is 50
parameters.name: limit

get.description: Retrieves meta information of markets.

parameters.description: Market symbol
parameters.name: symbol

get.description: Retrieves market funding rate data.

parameters.description: Market symbol
parameters.name: symbol

get.description: Retrieves markets information

parameters.description: Provide if a single market details is required
parameters.name: symbol

get.description: Retrieves the market contract addresses, chain rpc/URL, and other data.

parameters.description:
Market symbol
If not provided, returns market meta of all markets
parameters.name: symbol

get.description: Retrieves state of orderbook

parameters.description: Market symbol
parameters.name: symbol

parameters.description: Provide the total number of asks/bids to get. Max allowed value is 50
parameters.name: limit

get.description: Allows user to get their orders on exchange

parameters.description:
Market symbol for which the user wishes to get orders.
If not provided, API will return orders of all markets
parameters.name: symbol

parameters.description: Public address of parent account, if the user is a sub-account and wishes to fetch parent address orders
parameters.name: parentAddress

parameters.description: The unique id of the order when it is created
parameters.name: orderId

parameters.description:
Unique hashes of orders for which user wishes to get details of
an order that matches the given id qty etc. If the provided API will return orders that match the given hashes
parameters.name: orderHashes

parameters.description: Type of orders the user wants to fetch. By default, it retrieve orders of both order types
parameters.name: orderType

parameters.description: Status of orders user wants to fetch
parameters.name: statuses

parameters.description:
Number of records required per page. The exchange server allows a maximum of 75 orders per page
and is the default page size.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description:
Fetch order from a particular page number. Per page, there are 75 orders, so if a user has 100 filled orders,
he must call the method twice with page numbers 1 and 2 to get all 100 orders
parameters.name: pageNumber

get.description: Allows user to get their orders on the exchange

parameters.description: Market symbol for which the user wishes to get orders
parameters.name: symbol

parameters.description: The unique id of the order when it is created
parameters.name: orderId

parameters.description: If fetches orders as a subaccount
parameters.name: parentAddress

parameters.description: Unique hash of the order, which is the combination of some of the keys in the order route, like price
parameters.name: orderHashes

parameters.description: List of order statuses to be fetched for LIMIT orders, eg: [PENDING, OPEN, PARTIAL_FILLED]
parameters.name: limitStatuses

parameters.description: List of order statuses to be fetched for MARKET orders, eg: [PENDING]
parameters.name: marketStatuses

parameters.description: Number of records required per page. The exchange server allows a maximum of 75 orders per page
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description:
Fetch order from a particular page number. Per page, there are 75 orders, so if a user has 100 filled orders,
the method must be called twice on pages number 1 and 2 to get all 100 orders
parameters.name: pageNumber

delete.description:
Allows user to submit cancellation request for order(s) on the exchange
The cancellation signature must first be generated as a pre-requisite to this method

get.description: Retrieves recent trades executed on a market

parameters.description: Market symbol for which the user wishes to get its recent trades
parameters.name: symbol

parameters.description: If provided, it fetches recent trades from the specified trader on the market, with trader options including IsolatedTrader, IsolatedLiquidation, and IsolatedADL
parameters.name: traders

parameters.description:
The number of records required per page. The exchange server
allows a maximum of 50 records per page
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: The particular page number to be fetched
parameters.name: pageNumber

The number of records required per page.
The exchange server allows a maximum of 50 records per page.

The market symbol for which the user wishes to get funding history.
If not provided, the funding history of all markets will be fetched
parameters.name: symbol

parameters.description: Used to fetch funding history as a sub-account.
parameters.name: parentAddress

post.description:
Generates a referral code for a specific campaign. New users can use this referral code
during registration, to associate themselves with the referring campaign and user.

Links a referred user to a specific campaign using a referral code.
This process associates the referred user's address with the campaign
and the user who referred them. Upon successful linking, the method
returns information about the referral, including the referral code and referee address.

get.description: Allows user to check the referrer info against any campaign Id

parameters.description: For which user wants to see referrer info about
parameters.name: campaignId

get.description: Retrieves details about campaigns

Retrieves reward details for a specific campaign based on the provided campaign Id
It returns information about the rewards associated with the campaign.

parameters.description: The identifier of the campaign for which reward details are requested.

Retrieves a summary of maker rewards, providing information about
historical rewards, active rewards, and pending rewards for market makers.
Retrieves detailed information about maker rewards.

get.description: Retrieves the whitelist status of a user for market maker activities.
Retrieves user current open position on the exchange

parameters.description:
Market symbol for which the user wishes to get its open position.
If not provided then will return open position across all markets
parameters.name: symbol

parameters.description: Provide if fetch positions as a subaccount
parameters.name: parentAddress

parameters.description:
Number of records required per page.
The exchange server allows a maximum of 50 records per trade.
If the total markets are 75 and the user has open positions across all of them,
the returned response will only contain 50 open positions
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description:
Fetches open positions from a particular page number.
Per page, there are 50 records, so if a user has 100 open positions across 100 markets,
he must call the method twice with page numbers 1 and 2 to get all 100 positions
parameters.name: pageNumber

get.description: Retrieves user completed trades.

parameters.description: Market symbol for which the user wishes to get its trades
parameters.name: symbol

parameters.description: Provide if trading as a subaccount

parameters.description: If TRUE, then it will fetch trades where the user is the maker

parameters.description: Each trade is given an incremental id; provide the id to get trades after the provided id
parameters.name: fromId

parameters.description: The time after which trades will be fetched from
parameters.name: startTime

parameters.description: The time before which all trades will be returned
parameters.name: endTime

parameters.description: Is the number of records required per page. The exchange server allows a maximum of 50 records.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: Fetches user trades from a particular page number. Per page, there are 50 records, so if a user has 100 trades they must invoke the method twice, with page numbers being 1 and 2, to get all 100 trades
parameters.name: pageNumber

parameters.description: Each trade is given an incremental id; provide the id to get trades after the provided id

parameters.description: The time after which trades will be fetched from
parameters.name: startTime

parameters.description: The time before which all trades will be returned
parameters.name: endTime

parameters.description: Provide a total number of records to get. Max allowed value is 50

parameters.description: The particular page number to be fetched
